title: Bangladesh's New Leader Promises Democracy
summary: Bangladesh has a new leader named Tarique Rahman. His party, the Bangladesh Nationalist Party, won a big election on Thursday. He says he will work to make the country more democratic. The election was peaceful and watched by a temporary government. The old leader, Sheikh Hasina, was removed in 2024 after people protested. Rahman wants to fix problems like a weak economy and poor law and order. He asks everyone to stay united to keep democracy safe. Bangladesh is a country in South Asia with over 170 million people. The new government will start soon.
